whenHelpful.rationale: Helps detect physiological instability during consultation.
Used when findings will change immediate management.
Reserve for diagnostic uncertainty or higher risk presentations.

selfCare: Provide symptom-control advice tailored to current severity.
Confirm patient understands red-flag escalation instructions.
followUpLogic: Escalate same-day for suspected hypertensive emergency or acute end-organ symptoms.
Use home and clinic BP trends to guide treatment intensification and monitoring intervals.
Document adherence plan, side-effect review, and threshold-based safety-net advice.

returnAdvice: Seek urgent care for chest pain, breathlessness, severe headache, or neurological symptoms.
Seek urgent care for visual loss, confusion, or reduced urine output.
Return early if home readings remain severely elevated despite treatment changes.
